intro: Prochnyanthes bulliana, commonly known as the bull's horn plant, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, horn-shaped seed pods that develop after flowering. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Prochnyanthes bulliana is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
